data.title: Crew List USS Thatcher
data.meta_description:
LOOKING FOR CREW LIST USS THATCHER 
 USS Thatcher 514 Fletcher Class Destroyer WW2 
 Lay down by Bath ironworks, Bath Maine June 20, 1942 
 Launched December 6,
data.text:
Glenn W Simon

Thank you for posting your request on History Hub!

We searched the National Archives Catalog and located the Muster Rolls of U.S. Navy Ships, Stations, and Other Naval Activities, 1/1/1939 - 1/1/1949 in the Records of the Bureau of Naval Personnel (Record Group 24) that may include the muster rolls for the USS Thatcher in the 1940s. We also located the Logbooks of U.S. Navy Ships and Stations, 1941 - 1983 in Record Group 24 that might be of interest to you. Some of these records have been digitized and may be viewed online using the Catalog.

You may also wish to search the World War II War Diaries, Other Operational Records and Histories, ca. 1/1/1942 - ca. 6/1/1946 and the World War II War Diaries, 12/7/1941 - 12/31/1945 in the Records of the Office of the Chief of Naval Operations (Record Group 38) for information about the USS Thatcher. Many of these records have been digitized and may be viewed online as well.

Please contact RR2R at archives2reference@nara.gov for access to any non-digitized records or for more information about the series listed above.

Finally, we also suggest that you search the website of the Naval History and Heritage Command for additional resources related to the USS Thatcher during World War II. You may contact them directly for further assistance.

We hope this is helpful. Best of luck with your family research!

Donald M. Simon is listed in the USS Thatcher's November 1944 Report of Changes as transferring from the USS St. Louis to the USS Thatcher on Nov. 10, 1944.

Donald M. Simon is listed as a crew member on the December 1944 and March 1945 Quarterly Muster rolls of the USS Thatcher. On May 20, 1945, Simon was injured during a kamikaze attack and was transferred to the USS Gosper for treatment that same day. I could not find any record of him returning to the Thatcher.

The following is the USS Thrasher's After Action Report for May 20th, 1945:

The other May 20th casualties included:

ABBOTT, Milton G 606 39 31 CRT(AA)(T) Chief Radio Technician KIA ANDERSON, Louis C. 955 60 35 S2c Seaman, Second Class Transferred to USS Gosper (APA170) for treatment BIELOT, John 642 92 26 F1c Fireman, First Class Missing BRACKETT, William E. 955 60 12 S2c Seaman, Second Class Missing BREITMAYER, John W. 244 73 84 RdM2c Radarman Second Class Transferred to USS RELIEF (AH1) for treatment CARVER, J F 575 84 96 S2c Seaman, Second Class KIA CHABOT, Roland E. 2048462 RT2c Radio Technician, 2d Cl. KIA FLEMING, William A. Jr. 642 92 87 EM3c Electrician's Mate, 3d Cl. Transferred to USS RELIEF (AH1) for treatment JOHNSON, Harvey L. 154 70 94 BM1c Boatswain's Mate, First Class KIA KEILTY, Michael J. 852 35 26 F1c Fireman, First Class KIA KNACK, Ralph H. 709 39 33 SC2c Ship's Cook, Second Class Transferred to USS Gosper (APA170) for treatment LANG, Jack L. 755 03 18 S1c Seaman, First Class Transferred to USS Gosper (APA170) for treatment MASON, Daniel J. 877 67 64 RdM3c Radarman Third Class Died on board USS PAVLIC MLAKER, John J. 607 58 28 MM2c Machinist's Mate, Second Class MIA MONTPLAISIR, Norman J. 757 74 26 MM3c Machinist's Mate, Third Class MIA SCHOMMER, Harold E. 627 73 67 S1c Seaman, First Class KIA SIMON, Donald M. 620 65 94 PhM3c Pharmacists Mate 3rd Class Transferred to USS Gosper (APA170) for treatment SMITH, Paul R. 709 52 85 RDM1c Radarman, First Class Transferred to USS Gosper (APA170) for treatment WEIGAND, Walter J. 857 06 0_ MoMM2c Motor Machinist's Mate, Second Class KIA WENDELL, Russell H. 380 12 60 CBM(T) Chief Boatswain's Mate KIA

The Thatcher was attacked again by kamikazes on July 19th while at anchor in Buckner Bay, Okinawa, awaiting completion of repairs from the May 20th attack. Two sailors were injured during the attack. It seems that many of the USS Thatcher's crew were on leave while the ship was being repaired.
